title: What are the ATP Bonus Pool standings?
description: Thanks to the impact of OneVision, the transformational strategic plan that came into effect in 2023, there is plenty of Bonus Pool money up for grabs for players on the ATP Tour. ATP Masters 1000 and Nitto ATP Finals Bonus Pool payments in 2025 will be awarded to the 30 players who earn the most PIF ATP Rankings points at ATP Masters 1000 events and the Nitto ATP Finals this season, subject to participation. The total of this Bonus Pool is $21 million, up from $11.5 million in 2022. ATP Tour Masters 1000 & Nitto ATP Finals Bonus Pool Standings (following Rome)  Player  Tournaments  Points  1) Carlos Alcaraz  4  2410  2) Jack Draper  5  1960  3) Lorenzo Musetti  5  1600  4) Casper Ruud  5  1410  5) Jakub Mensik  4  1330  6) Francisco Cerundolo  5  950  7) Grigor Dimitrov  5  810  8) Daniil Medvedev  5  810  9) Alex de Minaur  5  800   10) Holger Rune  5  730  11) Arthur Fils  5  710  12) Novak Djokovic  4  680  13) Jannik Sinner  1  650  14) Tommy Paul  4  650  15) Taylor Fritz  4  610  16) Alejandro Davidovich Fokina  5  500  17) Stefanos Tsitsipas  5  450  18) Matteo Berrettini  5  450  19) Alexander Zverev  5  420  20) Brandon Nakashima  5  360  21) Alexei Popyrin  5  320  22) Sebastian Korda  5  320  23) Matteo Arnaldi  5  300  24) Gabriel Diallo  4  300  25) Ben Shelton  5  280  26) Tallon Griekspoor  4  270  27) Hubert Hurkacz  3  260  28) Karen Khachanov  5  260  29) Frances Tiafoe  5  260  30) Marcos Giron  5  240   Players also have an opportunity to earn a share of $3 million in the ATP 500 Bonus Pool, which is distributed among the top six players in the standings (also subject to participation). ATP 500 Bonus Pool (following Queen's Club & Halle)  Player  Tournaments  Points  1) Carlos Alcaraz  4  1,430  2) Andrey Rublev  5  1,030  3) Alexander Zverev  5  900  4) Felix Auger-Aliassime  4  780  T5) Stefanos Tsitsipas  4  750  T5) Denis Shapovalov  3  750  Return to this page after every ATP Masters 1000 and ATP 500 event to see updated Bonus Pool standings. html:

OneVision

View full standings below

May 27, 2025

Thanks to the impact of OneVision, the transformational strategic plan that came into effect in 2023, there is plenty of Bonus Pool money up for grabs for players on the ATP Tour.

ATP Masters 1000 and Nitto ATP Finals Bonus Pool payments in 2025 will be awarded to the 30 players who earn the most PIF ATP Rankings points at ATP Masters 1000 events and the Nitto ATP Finals this season, subject to participation.

The total of this Bonus Pool is $21 million, up from $11.5 million in 2022.

ATP Tour Masters 1000 & Nitto ATP Finals Bonus Pool Standings (following Rome)

 Player  Tournaments  Points
 1) Carlos Alcaraz  4  2410
 2) Jack Draper  5  1960
 3) Lorenzo Musetti  5  1600
 4) Casper Ruud  5  1410
 5) Jakub Mensik  4  1330
 6) Francisco Cerundolo  5  950
 7) Grigor Dimitrov  5  810
 8) Daniil Medvedev  5  810
 9) Alex de Minaur  5  800 
 10) Holger Rune  5  730
 11) Arthur Fils  5  710
 12) Novak Djokovic  4  680
 13) Jannik Sinner  1  650
 14) Tommy Paul  4  650
 15) Taylor Fritz  4  610
 16) Alejandro Davidovich Fokina  5  500
 17) Stefanos Tsitsipas  5  450
 18) Matteo Berrettini  5  450
 19) Alexander Zverev  5  420
 20) Brandon Nakashima  5  360
 21) Alexei Popyrin  5  320
 22) Sebastian Korda  5  320
 23) Matteo Arnaldi  5  300
 24) Gabriel Diallo  4  300
 25) Ben Shelton  5  280
 26) Tallon Griekspoor  4  270
 27) Hubert Hurkacz  3  260
 28) Karen Khachanov  5  260
 29) Frances Tiafoe  5  260
 30) Marcos Giron  5  240

Players also have an opportunity to earn a share of $3 million in the ATP 500 Bonus Pool, which is distributed among the top six players in the standings (also subject to participation).

ATP 500 Bonus Pool (following Hamburg)

 Player  Tournaments  Points
 1) Andrey Rublev  4  980
 2) Carlos Alcaraz  3  930
 3) Felix Auger-Aliassime  3  730
 T4) Stefanos Tsitsipas  3  700
 T4) Denis Shapovalov  2  700
 T4) Alexander Zverev  4  700 

Return to this page after every ATP Masters 1000 and ATP 500 event to see updated Bonus Pool standings.
